intro: Meistera aculeata var. gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded meistera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a capsule that matures into a smooth, round seed pod, giving the variety its common name.
